ENTRY       EC 6.3.2.44                 Enzyme
NAME        pantoate---beta-alanine ligase (ADP-forming);
            pantothenate synthetase (ambiguous);
            pantoate---beta-alanine ligase (ambiguous)
CLASS       Ligases;
            Forming carbon-nitrogen bonds;
            Acid-D-amino-acid ligases (peptide synthases)
SYSNAME     (R)-pantoate:beta-alanine ligase (ADP-forming)
REACTION    ATP + (R)-pantoate + beta-alanine = ADP + phosphate + (R)-pantothenate [RN:R10821]
ALL_REAC    R10821
SUBSTRATE   ATP [CPD:C00002];
            (R)-pantoate [CPD:C00522];
            beta-alanine [CPD:C00099]
PRODUCT     ADP [CPD:C00008];
            phosphate [CPD:C00009];
            (R)-pantothenate [CPD:C00864]
COMMENT     The enzyme, characterized from the archaeon Methanosarcina mazei, is involved in the biosynthesis of pantothenate. It is different from EC 6.3.2.1, the AMP-forming pantoate-beta-alanine ligase found in bacteria and eukaryota.
HISTORY     EC 6.3.2.44 created 2014

  TITLE     A novel isoform of pantothenate synthetase in the Archaea.
  JOURNAL   FEBS J 275:2754-64 (2008)
            DOI:10.1111/j.1742-4658.2008.06416.x
  SEQUENCE  [mma:MM_2281]
